newsitem.title: ITALY: Italian woman turns herself in to join husband.
newsitem.headline: Italian woman turns herself in to join husband.

text.p: An Italian woman convicted on a drugs charge travelled to Florence and asked police to arrest her because her husband is in the local prison.
The 31-year-old woman turned herself in at a Carabinieri paramilitary police station in Florence, 300 km (190 miles) south of her home in Vicenza, ANSA news agency said on Thursday.

It said the woman, who was not named, had to serve 19 months in jail for a drugs conviction. Her husband, 51, has been in Sollicciano prison outside Florence for two years in a drugs case, ANSA added. Sollicciano has men's and women's sections.
Under Italian law, people convicted of crimes can often stay out of jail until the sentence has been confirmed on appeal.
